channel.title: [VB] When notepad closes it closes whole app?
channel.description: I have it so it opens txt files, but when you close the text file (opened with notepad) it also closes the whole program...

item.title: [VB] When notepad closes it closes whole app?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Coder xynt, post:1, topic:238500”]^C# > VB
Frell, I’m not very sure what you want to do, but I suggest you learn basic I/O. Here is an example of I/O using the StreamReader and StreamWriter classes in C#:

[code]
using System.in;

class FileIO
{
static void Main()
{
StreamReader reader = new StreamReader(“hia.txt”);
StreamWriter = new StreamWriter(“WHATEVER.txt”);
writer.WriteLine(reader.ReadLine());
writer.Close();
}
}[/code]Since you know basic I/O in Java, this should be easy to read for you.[/quote]
You’re a retard, System.in doesn’t exist, and you could use the File class to accomplish what you did with one line of code.

Read full topic

item.title: [VB] When notepad closes it closes whole app?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

His question was the following:
I open the application, I click on a button, a text file opens in notepad, I close notepad, the whole application closes.

You answered:
I open the application, I click a button, and then I want to open a textfile in the application. How would I do that?

Those two questions are not the same, and combining that with the fact that Frell isn’t into this anymore, and adding up that this question is quite old, I come to the conclusion that your post and the discussion followed by it was pointless.

Read full topic

[quote=“Frell, post:12, topic:192838”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=256666.msg2136232#msg2136232 date=1206515206]

I dont know how, i use VB cause its kinda quick and simple

Clearly it’s not very simple if you’re resorting to open NOTEPAD for FILE IO. Try Google.
[/quote]
Already tried. Nothing.

I just need it to open a txt file for editing[/quote]

I still don’t get his main problem, I don’t see any way of his application going down with notepad, unless he has a timer on his form that checks if notepad is open and if return false then close itself.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 22, 2008, 11:44:05 am[/size][hr]

Go out, play with your friends, get a life.

And I’ll take that back, I find it very hard to believe you have any friends.

item.title: [VB] When notepad closes it closes whole app?
item.dc:creator: @Dark_Anima Dark Anima
item.description:
@Dark_Anima wrote:

If all you need to do is open a textfile for editing in your program, notepad really shouldn’t have anything to do with it.
Put a richtextbox as your “notepad”, in where ever you want in your form.
Here’s a function for you to open the file:
( I can’t test any of these now, so there might be mis-spellings. )

Private sub loadfile(Byval path as string) Dim Streamreader as new System.Io.Streamreader(path) RichTextBox1.text = Streamreader.readtoend Streamreader.close End sub

For example if you want to get text from C:\yourfile.txt, you would just write 'loadfile(“C:\yourfile.txt”)

and Here’s to save it.

Private sub loadfile(Byval path as string) Dim Streamwriter as new System.Io.Streamwriter(path, false) 'Creates the file if it doesn't exist. Streamwriter.write(RichTextBox1.text) Streamwriter.close End sub

There are OpenFileDialogs, and SaveFileDialogs to pop out the menu for selecting where to save/what to open, but I don’t have the time to explain how those work for now, they’re pretty simple.

Read full topic
